r.d: Allow one to use htaccess-like file to configure PHP per directory, just like apache's htaccess. It is especially useful with fastcgi. This package was originally developed by Bart Vanbrabant. Old versions are available from: http://files.zoeloelip.be/htscanner
r.n: - Request #10017, added a new ini option to disable RINIT errors: htscanner.stop_on_error When set to 1 htscanner returns a failure when an error occured internally (cache, doc_root missing, etc.). If it is et to 0 (the default) it will simply return SUCCESS and do nothing. It is useful if you have only one php.ini for cli and cgi or if you compiled it staticaly.
